plugins.name: Infa
plugins.description:
What is Infa

Manage your design system inventory directly within your product's webpage. Learn more at https://infa.ai/


What does the Figma Plugin for Figma unlock?

Pull all the screenshots and code snippets for your component views from Infa into FigJam. This enhances your design system review sessions by enabling visual and code comparisons of components. Navigate back to the component in your real product through our Chrome extension, ensuring that your design critiques are grounded in actual product usage.


How to Get Started:

  1. Install the Chrome Extension: Create components and select them within the Chrome Extension:https://infa.ai/chrome-extension
  2. Upgrade to Pro: Upgrade your account to Pro and upload your board to the cloud to connect your Figma plugin.
  3. Take Screenshots and Capture Code: Open component views in the Chrome Extension and click on "Take Screenshot" or "Capture Code" to make them available in your plugin.
  4. Authenticate: Open the Figma plugin and enter your API key from your Info account to authenticate. https://infa.ai/profile#api
  5. Import Components: Select the components to import screenshots and code into FigJam.


Contact Us:

For any questions or recommendations, please reach out to us at contact@infa.ai
plugins.tagline: New way of Conducting Design System Inventory and Visualizing Design System in use with Infa

plugins.description:
Dynogee is an easy and quick tool to expose your Figma designs as an API:


  1. ‚ú® Swap text and images with dynamic content
  2. üìê Create pixel perfect copies of your design
  3. üèéÔ∏è Supa-fast rendering times, render images on-the-fly
  4. üöÄ We thought of it: custom fonts, truncation, i18n, you name it


It‚Äôs like Figma's Export feature, but as an API. üí´


How to use the plugin


  1. Select a frame in Figma, and open the plugin
  2. Define layers for which you want to provide content via the API
  3. Create your template üöÄ


Pro tip: Set a max height on text layers to enforce truncation. ‚úÇÔ∏è


Features


Full creative freedom

Use your brand fonts, colors and more to create high-fidelity dynamic images ‚ú®


Fast rendering

Our backend is optimized to generate and distribute your images without long wait times. Often images are generated in as little as 200ms.


Handoff your templates to developers

Each template your create comes with it's own documentation and playground environment, making it trivial for your engineering team to make use of the image rendering API.


Contact


If you want to share your feedback, please reach out to us at support@dynogee.com.

plugins.name: design-tokens.io Figma Plugin
plugins.description:
This is the Figma plugin for design-tokens.io


design-tokens.io is the real-time hub for your Design Tokens.


Ensure design consistency across multiple brands, themes and projects.

Accelerate release cycles through seamless handoffs between designers and developers.

Built for agencies and enterprise design teams.


Consistency across all brands

Keep a single source of truth for all your Design Tokens. All your themes stay 100% interchangable, by default.


Seamless import & export

Import and export your Design Tokens as W3C-compliant JSON. Avoid vendor lock-in.


Real-time collaboration

Multiple users manage Design Tokens, themes and brands at the same time. No workflow bottlenecks, no data conflicts.


Bridge design and development

Designers sync their Design Tokens with Figma variables in real-time. Developers receive CSS/SASS variables. No manual handoffs necessary.



FAQs


What if I already use Figma Variables?

That‚Äôs fine! Our platform natively supports Figma Variables while protecting you from their limited scalability and interoperability. It acts as a single-source-of-truth for all your Design Tokens and integrates with all your tools, not just Figma.


I only use the free Figma plan. Will this work for me?

Yes! Our Figma plugin works with every Figma plan, even the free one. It lets you import your Design Tokens into Figma and sync your changes in real-time, no matter how many tokens, themes and brands you manage.


Why not use Tokens Studio?

Tokens Studio is great, but it is primarily a Figma plugin - intended to be used by Figma users from within Figma. It even stores all your Design Tokens inside Figma.

Our platform takes the opposite approach: It is a standalone, single-purpose data hub that lets your whole team collaborate on your Design Tokens and syncs them to all your tools, not just Figma.


We're already using Supernova. Is this compatible?

Absolutely! You can start using our platform in tandem with Supernova today, since Supernova will import your Design Tokens from Figma as usual. We're also working on a native Supernova hook that will make the process even more seamless!


Is the platform W3C-compliant?

Yes! Our platform ensures maximum interoperability with all your other tools by being fully compliant with the latest version of the W3C Design Tokens specification. You can seamlessly import and export Design Tokens as W3C DTCG JSON.


What's the learning curve for my team?

Our platform is reportedly much easier to use than comparable tools and was designed from the ground up to make managing and accessing Design Tokens as simple as possible.

You will be up and running in a matter of minutes. Watch demo
plugins.tagline: Auto-sync your Design Tokens from design-tokens.io to Figma

VibeGen lets you capture the *vibe* of any reference image and use it to generate something completely new, right inside Figma. Upload a reference, enter a prompt, and remix your inspiration into fresh icons, mockups, graphics, and more.


‚ú® Features:

  1. Upload a reference image to instantly capture its style.

  5. Automatically remove backgrounds for clean assets.
  6. Designed for speed ‚Äî built directly into Figma.

plugins.name: Handoff
plugins.description:
Design ü§ù Dev Handoff


Design to dev done right. A Figma plugin to turn design variabes + styles into Tailwind & POSTCSS.


Learn more on Github.


Features


- Convert Figma variables + styles to Tailwind config variables

- Convert Figma text styles to POSTCSS syntax with responsive media queries

- Consolidate design + dev tokens into one source of truth, extensible by designers and developers


Usage


1. Install the plugin from the Figma Community

2. Open the plugin from the Figma toolbar

3. Generate handoff files (.json and .postcss) from the plugin

4. Pass files to developers to integrate into their Tailwind config and Tailwind `@component` layers


Text Styles


The plugin will convert Figma text styles to POSTCSS syntax with responsive media queries. The plugin will also generate a JSON file with the font sizes. The plugin is opinionated as to what gets converted to a class, so it's recommended to review the generated POSTCSS file and adjust as needed.


The POSTCSS file will work from the smallest breakpoint to the largest, assigning media queries using Tailwind's `screen` function as breakpoints appear. Properties are diffed to the base style and only novel properties are added to the media query.

.body-1 {
font-family: Inter;
font-size: 16px;
line-height: 24px;
font-weight: 400;
letter-spacing: 0.5px;

@media screen(md) {
font-size: 2.75rem;
}

@media screen(lg) {
font-size: 3.5rem;
}
}


Naming Schema


The naming schema works so that we capture only the most important classes. For the sake of brevity, we only capture the default classes, defined as not having any variants or as being named the `default` variant.


{viewport}/{style}/{variant}


- `viewport` - The viewport size in Tailwind syntax (e.g. `sm`, `md`, `lg`, `xl`). This corresponds directly to the `Screens` variables, so a matching entry should exist in that variable collection.

- `style` - The Figma text style name, such as `display-1` or `body-3`. This is semantic and can be named anything, but it should be consistent across the design system. The styles for this should be the _default_ styles, as in the most common styles used in the design system for this type of text.

- `variant` - The variant of the style in semantic or property synax, such as `bold`, `italic`, `uppercase`, `lowercase`, `capitalize`, `normal`, `underline`, `line-through`, `no-underline`. This is optional and can be omitted if the style does not have a variant. NOTE: A `default` style MUST be named here in order to be converted to POSTCSS (ex: `md/body-3/default`).


Variables


The plugin will convert Figma variables and effects styles to Tailwind config variables via a resulting JSON file matching the Tailwind configuration. The plugin is optimized to account for a few key properties such as `screens`, `spacing`, `backdropBlur`, `blur`, `borderRadius`, etc, which are numbers converted specially to corresponding formats. The ability to customize a properties format is in the works. Need it sooner? Open an issue and we can prioritize it.


NOTE Library names *must* match the proper Tailwind config name in order to extend the configuration properly.


{
"colors": {
"primary": "#FF0000",
"secondary": "#00FF00",
"tertiary": "#0000FF"
},
"spacing": {
"1": "0.25rem",
"2": "0.5rem",
"3": "0.75rem"
},
"screens": {
"sm": "640px",
"md": "768px",
"lg": "1024px",
"xl": "1280px"
}
}

plugins.name: [NEW] Gleef - Translate and localize with AI
plugins.description:
Designed for teams to automate translation and streamline localization tasks directly in Figma.


Key Features

  1. Time-saving AI generation: Automate translation, key naming and searching, eliminating manual tasks and reduce the time spent on localization management.
  2. Workflow optimization: Maintain clarity and consistency by adhering to your project's naming conventions while preventing duplicate keys.
  3. Project organization: Easily track translated and pending keys to keep your localization projects on schedule.
  4. Code quality: Ensure formatting consistency across your localization files for polished and professional results.


How Gleef works

  1. Import your localization files: Quickly upload your existing localization files to get started.
  2. Select source language: Choose the source language for translations, typically the language used in your Figma designs.
  3. Choose screens / frames: Select one or multiple screens you're localizing within your Figma project.
  4. Adjust translations and keys: Maintain full control, adjust translations before exporting, allowing for fine-tuning of re-used and generated keys.
  5. Export ready files: Import the new keys into your preferred localization tool or copy-paste the updated locale file directly into your IDE.


Integrate Gleef into your Figma workflow, to significantly improve your localization process, save time and ensure consistency across your global product designs.

plugins.name: Random values generator
plugins.description:
This plugin is created to help you save time and speed up productivity by allowing you generate random values with just a click.

You can quickly create numeric, alphanumeric, or pattern-based random values.

Whether you‚Äôre prototyping, testing input fields, or designing layouts, this plugin ensures precision and speed by generating values tailored to your needs.


How to use

  1. Run the Random Values generator plugin
  2. Select one or multiple text layers
  3. Select the type of values you want, enter your preferred number of character and click on ‚ÄòGenerate values‚Äù
  4. The pattern-based values allow you to define the format in which random values are generated. For example, by using "X" for random alphabets and "#" for random numbers, you can control the structure of the output. Separators such as - (dash), . (dot), and _ (underscore) can also be included to customize the format further.

Example Patterns:

X#XX## could generate D3FR53.

##XX#X-XX## could generate 06CO2M-FC92.

This feature allows you to create structured, randomized values for placeholders, tokens, or testing data with ease.


Use cases:

  1. Populating Placeholder Data : Use the plugin to generate realistic placeholder values for prototypes, such as: Unique identifiers (e.g., serial numbers, order numbers, or product codes).
  2. Form fields like usernames, passwords, or verification codes
  3. Generate unique codes and simulate real world data: Generate pattern-based values to mimic specific real-world data, such as: License plates, invoice numbers, customer IDs, coupons, gift card, events tickets
  4. Testing UI scalability: Check how your designs handle varying lengths and types of values, ensuring components like input fields, labels, and tables remain responsive and visually consistent.


Need any help or have questions? Please reach out


Show me some support
plugins.tagline: Generate random values for your project

For more customization, designers can also download the After Effects (.aep) files from Ecco Icon website to tweak colors or use them in mockups.


Is it really free?

Yes, it is! No paywalls or registration required. All icons, including animated versions, are free to use under the Creative Commons BY 4.0 license.

Thanks to your generous donations, the project continues to grow with even more icons and features!


This icon pack is created and maintained with love by Sajjad Dashti‚Äîgraphic designer, product designer, and motion designer. For any inquiries, feel free to contact me at hi@sajjaddashti.ir.

plugins.name: Navigator
plugins.description:
Navigator is your personal navigation assistant in Figma. It allows you to bookmark up to 4 frames across your project for instant access. It supports across page access as well.


Navigator is perfect for designers working on large projects, enabling efficient navigation and improved productivity. Leap through your designs with ease and speed up your workflow today!




HOW TO:

Select a frame and click "Add Link" to bookmark it

Use the saved links to instantly navigate to your bookmarked frames

Clear individual links or all links as needed

Toggle the UI to keep your workspace clean

plugins.name: Asterisk
plugins.description:
Annotate your designs with Asterisk!


Creating annotations

  1. Annotate to the left, right, above or below a target
  2. Add an optional header
  3. Add optional notes (Shift+Enter to add multiple lines)
  4. Add smaller secondary notes and an optional URL
  5. Customize the spacing between an annotation and its target
  6. Choose the color of an annotation


Global controls

  1. Show/hide all annotations on a page
  2. Lock/unlock all annotations on a page
  3. Delete all annotations on a page
  4. Refresh annotation locations (useful if a component instance inherits changes and moves)


Quality of life features

  1. Annotations follow their targets*
  2. Move an existing annotation to a new target
  3. Change any property of a selected annotation even after it was created
  4. Press Enter after typing in an input to quickly create an annotation
  5. Collapse the UI so you can keep it open but out of the way
  6. Double click any color in the UI to change Asterisk's theme!
  7. Dark mode support


Annotation tuning

  1. Customize annotation max width
  2. Change text size
  3. Show / hide author names on annotations
  4. Apply your tunings to all annotations on a page at once


* Asterisk must be open for annotations to follow their targets
plugins.tagline: Annotations everyone can see

plugins.name: Syncfusion¬Æ Design Tokens
plugins.description:
Syncfusion¬Æ Design Tokens: The Premier Figma Plugin for Seamless Theme Generation

The Syncfusion¬Æ Design Tokens plugin offers a professional and efficient solution for translating style changes made in Figma into custom Syncfusion¬Æ themes, ready to be applied in your applications. This tool eliminates the need for manual style transfers, streamlining the design-to-development workflow.


Key Features:

  1. Custom Theme Creation: Tailor Syncfusion¬Æ component styles in Figma to align with your unique brand identity.
  2. Effortless Token Export: Export design tokens directly from Figma with ease.
  3. Seamless Integration: Utilize the exported tokens to create custom themes in Theme Studio and implement them in your applications.


How It Works:

This streamlined process involves three simple steps:

1.Customize Your Theme

Modify the styles of Syncfusion¬Æ components within Figma to reflect your brand‚Äôs identity and design requirements.

2.Export Design Tokens

Leverage the Syncfusion¬Æ Design Tokens plugin to export your custom design tokens. The plugin generates two essential files:

  1. css-variables.css: This file contains CSS variables for both light and dark themes, derived directly from your Figma designs. Import it into your application alongside the component styles to implement your custom designs. For detailed usage, refer to the CSS Variables Documentation.
  2. -tokens.json: This JSON file (e.g., material3-tokens.json) includes style variables and values compatible with Theme Studio for further customization.

3. Tokens to Theme Files

This <theme-name>-tokens.json file, prefixed with the corresponding theme name, can be imported into Theme Studio for further customization. After processing in Theme Studio, you can download the updated styles file and integrate it into your application, bringing your custom themes to life.


Benefits:

  1. Efficiency: Minimize manual tasks and reduce errors by automating the design-to-development process.
  2. Consistency: Ensure a uniform appearance across your applications by aligning design and development seamlessly.
  3. Scalability: Easily adapt and reuse custom themes across multiple projects.


With the Syncfusion¬Æ Design Tokens plugin, you can bridge the gap between design and development, creating cohesive and visually stunning user experiences with ease.

plugins.name: popcons
plugins.description:
Popcons is a powerful Figma plugin that takes icon customization to the next level.

Unlike conventional icon libraries, Popcons allows you to instantly modify and compare different styles, just like fonts.


Once an icon is imported, you can edit, modify, and adjust it with a single button, eliminating the need for manual replacements.

With support for 6 thickness levels, 4 styles (Line, Solid, Line Color, Full Color), and 3 roundness options, Popcons provides unparalleled flexibility. Additionally, icons can be further enhanced with decorative elements to suit your design needs.


Now, icons can seamlessly adapt to your brand identity and design language.


-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Key Features of Popcons


‚úî One-Click Editing ‚Äì Instantly modify icons and compare different styles, just like fonts

‚úî 6 Thickness Levels ‚Äì Easily adjust the weight to fit your design

‚úî 4 Styles ‚Äì

* Line ‚Äì Clean and minimal outline style

* Solid ‚Äì Bold and filled for strong emphasis

* Line Color ‚Äì Customizable stroke color for additional versatility

* Full Color ‚Äì Vibrant and expressive icon style

‚úî 3 Roundness Options ‚Äì Adjust corner roundness to match your aesthetic

‚úî Decorative Additions ‚Äì Enhance icons with additional design elements

‚úî Seamless Figma Integration ‚Äì A smooth, intuitive workflow for designers



-------------------------------------------------------------------------


How Can You Use Popcons?


* UI/UX Design ‚Äì Maintain a consistent icon style across web and mobile apps

* Brand Identity ‚Äì Adjust icons to align with your brand‚Äôs design system

* Presentations & Infographics ‚Äì Visually compelling icons for effective communication

* Developer Collaboration ‚Äì Keep icons flexible and adaptable within a design system

* Quick Style Testing & Comparison ‚Äì Instantly switch between styles and compare different options



-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Why Choose Popcons?


* Font-Like Customization ‚Äì Modify icons dynamically without replacing them

* Time-Saving Workflow ‚Äì Instantly compare and apply different styles with a single click

* Design Consistency ‚Äì Ensure uniformity across your project with structured customization

* Highly Flexible ‚Äì Adapt icons to fit various use cases effortlessly



-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Popcons ‚Äì Make Your Icons Pop, Instantly.

plugins.name: Design Pulse
plugins.description:
Automatically check and maintain design consistency across your Figma files. This plugin helps you ensure that all elements follow your design system guidelines.


Key Features:

‚Ä¢ Color Styles - Ensure colors are linked to styles

‚Ä¢ Typography - Check text styles consistency

‚Ä¢ Effects - Validate shadow and blur styles

‚Ä¢ Spacing - Check auto-layout spacing variables

‚Ä¢ Storke - Verify stroke style usage

‚Ä¢ Corner Radius - Validate radius consistency


How to use:

1. Select any frame in your design

2. Click "Run Checker"

3. Review the results

4. Click on any item to inspect and fix inconsistencies


Perfect for:

‚úì Design System Managers

‚úì UI/UX Designers

‚úì Design QA

‚úì Team Leads


The plugin provides real-time feedback and makes it easy to maintain design consistency across your projects.
plugins.tagline: Keep your design system's heartbeat strong
